discussion.content:
Supported Out-Of-Band DMTF Relay Methods
 - h245-alphanumeric DTMF Relay via H245 Alphanumeric IE
 - h245-signal DTMF Relay via H245 Signal IE
 - sip-NOTIFY DTMF Relay via SIP NOTIFY messages
 - sip-kpml DTMF Relay via KPML over SIP SUBCRIBE/NOTIFY
 Note: SIP INFO is not supported by Unified CM.
 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-border-element/200412-DTMF-Relay-and-Interworking-on-CUBE.html#toc-hId--1758568502

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. When setting up a new connection to Cisco UCM, the engineer must use out-of-band DTMF. Which configuration meets this requirement?

An organization has decided to implement hunt groups to help with the distribution of calls between different members. The administrator must configure hunt groups on Cisco UCM. In the configuration, at which step does an administrator have the option to configure a distribution algorithm (top down, circular, longest idle time, broadcast)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Configure Line Groups
Step 1 - From Cisco Unified CM Administration, choose Call Routing > Route/Hunt > Line Group.

Step 2 - Choose one of the following options:
- Click Add New to create a new line group.
- Click Find and select an existing line group.

Step 3 - Enter a Line Group Name.

Step 4 - From the Distribution Algorithm field, select the type of algorithm that you want to use to distribute calls. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_0_1/systemConfig/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1201/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1201_chapter_010101.html#CUCM_TK_C408FEDB_00

comments.content: Hunt list only have an option to add the line groups. we cannot configure the distribution algorithm in hunt list. It is only possible in Line group.

The answer is: C. hunt list.

A hunt list is a group of directory numbers that are configured to ring a group of phones in a specific order. The distribution algorithm determines the order in which the phones in the hunt list will ring. The four distribution algorithms available in Cisco UCM are:

Top down: The first phone in the hunt list will ring first, followed by the second phone, and so on.
Circular: The phones in the hunt list will ring in a circular order. The first phone in the list will ring first, followed by the last phone, then the second to last, and so on.
Longest idle time: The phone in the hunt list that has been idle the longest will ring first.
Broadcast: All of the phones in the hunt list will ring at the same time.
To configure a distribution algorithm, you must create a hunt list and then specify the distribution algorithm in the hunt list configuration.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A company is using Microsoft Teams with Cisco Unified Border Element integration, but the administrator sees a one-way audio issue with Microsoft Teams. The administrator must modify the SIP profile to send the proper information on the SDP for IP address for media to match the internal and external interface. Which set of commands resolves the issue?

choices.C:
voice class sip-profiles 1
request INVITE sdp-header Connection add “2\.76\.1” “2.78.1”
choices.D:
voice class sip-profiles 1
request INVITE sdp-header Audio-Attribute modify “2\.76\.1” “2.71.1”
choices.B:
voice class sip-profiles 1
request INVITE sdp-header Session-Owner modify “27\.0\.0” “27.3.0”
choices.A:
voice class sip-profiles 1
request INVITE sdp-header Connection-Info modify “2\.76\.1” “2.78.1”

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer is A and its somewhat incomplete. I mean it will work sort of but, typically you would include the whole Ip address and not just trying to change the last three octets of the IP Addresses in the C= Connection Info header. The Syntax for "C" is wrong. ALSO, those IPs do not even match anything in the diagram at all making it useless. Typical.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Correct answer is A 
Connection-info is the sdp header to modify.

choices.B: Add a SIP route pattern for *.*.
choices.C: Select “Block Pattern” on the *.cisco.com route pattern.
choices.A: Change the “Route Partition” setting on the *.cisco.com route pattern.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In option "B," the last dot is just the period of the sentence. This might seem like a dumb thing to bring up, but I initially fell for it. If we consider the last period as part of the route pattern, then that would make this answer incorrect, but since it is not, then B is correct.

In option "B," the last dot is just the period of the sentence. This might seem like a dumb thing to bring up, but I initially fell for it. If we consider the last period as part of the route pattern, then that would make this answer incorrect, but since it is not, then B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting a Cisco UCM issue where users report that calls placed to the domain cisco.com are failing and calls to sip.cisco.com are working. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Audio direction attribute is set to inactive.

Selected Answer: C
C appears to be correct/

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. This message is sent to the device being placed on hold for the Music On Hold audio setup. The held party reports receiving dead air rather than music when the call was put on hold. The software Music On Hold server on Cisco UCM is used in this scenario. Assume that the audio leg between the Music On Hold server and the held device uses G.711, and the relevant region relationship is configured for 64 kbps. What is the cause of the issue?

choices.B: The device that is placed on hold does not support G.711, and a transcoder could not be allocated for the call.
choices.A: The bandwidth configured for this region relationship is too low and must be increased to 96 kbps or higher.
choices.D: The Music On Hold server does not support G.711 and a transcoder could not be allocated for the call.
choices.C: Cisco UCM is sending a=inactive to the held device.
